events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at the intersection downtown.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial incident report and vehicle details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the case and contact the claimant for next steps.
The insured was notified that their claim has been acknowledged and is currently under review.
The insured was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the accident report.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including photos, police report, and repair estimates promptly.
The insurance company initiated an investigation to verify the facts surrounding the auto accident claim.
The investigation has been completed confirming fault of the other driver and assessing damages to the vehicle.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to the claimant to cover repair costs and rental car fees.
The claimant provided positive feedback appreciating the prompt settlement proposal and help received.
The claim was officially approved after acceptance of the settlement terms by the insured.
Payment was processed and issued to cover the vehicle repair costs in accordance with the settlement.
The claim was officially closed after confirming the insured received payment and had vehicle repairs completed.
All case files were archived securely in the system for future reference and audit purposes.
